title: Another day another high: Gold surges past $5,000 as investors seek shelter from global risks
summary: The surge comes as recent flashpoints from Greenland and Venezuela to the Middle East underscore higher geopolitical risk, while fiscal concerns also loom large.

title: The Looming LNG Glut and What It Means for Global Energy Prices
summary: As several countries invest in expanding their liquid natural gas (LNG) production and export capacity, and significant quantities of the gas are expected to come online in 2026 after a record 2025, supply could soon outpace demand. title: Gold records best week since 2008 as Greenland crisis rattles dollar
summary: Precious metal closes in on $5,000 and silver tops $100 as Trump’s shortlived tariffs threat sparks rush to safe havens

title: Yen rallies as ‘rate check’ sparks intervention speculation
summary: Japanese currency rises most since August after New York Fed queries market participants on price levels

title: Venezuela’s Heavy Oil Gets a Lifeline from US Naphtha

title: U.S. Oil Drillers Add One Rig as Winter Weather Sets In
summary: The total number of active drilling rigs for oil and gas in the United States rose by 1 this week, according to new data that Baker Hughes published on Friday, bringing the total rig count in the US to 544 this week, down 32 from this same time last year.
